content.body: if mutation is desired to be avoided, `toEmpty()` could be used, but then its essentially `= []` and falls under the same issues as it, so it becomes worthless
content.formatted_body: if mutation is desired to be avoided, toEmpty() could be used, but then its essentially = [] and falls under the same issues as it, so it becomes worthless

content.body: Symmetry with other languages is generally something I'm in favor of when designing new features but is not in itself adequate reason to add a new feature when there is already a fine way of accomplishing the same thing.
tbh I don't understand the reasoning against adding methods to `Array.prototype`, or rather I couldn't even find one
content.formatted_body: tbh I don't understand the reasoning against adding methods to Array.prototype, or rather I couldn't even find one

content.body: what was linked were *statements* of Mozilla's (and them only) stance against them, with no actual backstory on the reasoning
content.formatted_body: what was linked were statements of Mozilla's (and them only) stance against them, with no actual backstory on the reasoning

content.body: the reason was that adding methods with reasonable names breaks websites
e.g. we tried to add `groupBy` and that broke stuff, and then we tried `group` instead and that broke other stuff
content.formatted_body: e.g. we tried to add groupBy and that broke stuff, and then we tried group instead and that broke other stuff

content.body: and the breakage is often quite subtle
